pullRequest.title: Github action to test performance of genie private portal
pullRequest.bodyText:
Describe changes proposed in this pull request:

Tests genie-private POST /api/mutated-genes/fetch endpoint
Fails if:

curl returns a non-zero exit code
request returns a response code other than 200


On failure or success sends a message to slack
Runs at 3am EST

NOTE this test will initially fail until genie private performance improves.
We plan to add more performance tests like this in the future.
Co-authored by: Robert Sheridan 7747489+sheridancbio@users.noreply.github.com
Co-authored by: Avery Wang 18199796+averyniceday@users.noreply.github.com

commit.message:
Added Github action genie-performance-test.yml
- Tests genie-private POST /api/mutated-genes/fetch endpoint
- Fails if:
  1) curl returns a non-zero exit code
  2) request returns a response code other than 200
- On failure or success sends a message to slack
- Runs at 3am EST

Co-authored by: Robert Sheridan <7747489+sheridancbio@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored by: Avery Wang <18199796+averyniceday@users.noreply.github.com>

nodes.bodyText: nice! so cool! I love that it's easy to see in code where to sign up for this alert. One question: is this channel private? I can't seem to join - maybe ok if this channel is public?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+name: genie-performance-test
+
+on:
+  schedule:
+    - cron:  '0 8 * * *'
+
+jobs:
+  probe-genie-endpoint:
+    
+    name: Genie private endpoint probe
+
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    
+    env:
+      SLACK_URL_SECRET: ${{ secrets.SLACK_URL_SECRET }}
+      SLACK_CHANNEL: backend-performance-status

nodes.bodyText: @mandawilson Nice! Would it be possible to also log the time the response took somewhere? Maybe it can be sent both to stdout and to the slack channel? That way even if it maybe doesn't go over the threshold we would have some idea of whether response time has changed over time.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+name: genie-performance-test
+
+on:
+  schedule:
+    - cron:  '0 8 * * *'
+
+jobs:
+  probe-genie-endpoint:
+    
+    name: Genie private endpoint probe
+
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    
+    env:
+      SLACK_URL_SECRET: ${{ secrets.SLACK_URL_SECRET }}
+      SLACK_CHANNEL: backend-performance-status 
+
+    steps:
+    - name: GET request to genie private page
+      env:
+        GENIE_DATA_ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET: ${{ secrets.GENIE_DATA_ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET }}
+        MAX_WAIT_TIME_IN_SECONDS: 300
+        URL: "https://genie-private.cbioportal.org/api/mutated-genes/fetch"
+        OK_RESPONSE_CODE: 200
+      # GET request to URL with a MAX_WAIT_TIME_IN_SECONDS second limit
+      #   if curl fails, automatically exit with curl's non-zero exit code
+      #   else if we did not get a OK_RESPONSE_CODE exit with a non-zero exit code
+      #   else we are OK!
+      run: |
+        curl --max-time $MAX_WAIT_TIME_IN_SECONDS -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" -X POST -H "Authorization:Bearer $GENIE_DATA_ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET" "$URL" -H "accept:application/json" -H "Content-Type:application/json" -d "{\"studyIds\":[\"genie_private\"]}" > curl.out

nodes.bodyText: Maybe this is ok just to get the test in place ... but I think the max wait time in seconds for the mutated-genes fetch should be something like 5-10 seconds
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+name: genie-performance-test
+
+on:
+  schedule:
+    - cron:  '0 8 * * *'
+
+jobs:
+  probe-genie-endpoint:
+    
+    name: Genie private endpoint probe
+
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    
+    env:
+      SLACK_URL_SECRET: ${{ secrets.SLACK_URL_SECRET }}
+      SLACK_CHANNEL: backend-performance-status 
+
+    steps:
+    - name: GET request to genie private page
+      env:
+        GENIE_DATA_ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET: ${{ secrets.GENIE_DATA_ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET }}
+        MAX_WAIT_TIME_IN_SECONDS: 300

nodes.bodyText:
maybe add : rm curl.out  (or better : rm $CURL_OUTPUT_FILENAME)
I'm not sure where this is running though --- if it is an ephemeral circle-ci kind of machine, maybe cleanup is unnecessary.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+name: genie-performance-test
+
+on:
+  schedule:
+    - cron:  '0 8 * * *'
+
+jobs:
+  probe-genie-endpoint:
+    
+    name: Genie private endpoint probe
+
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    
+    env:
+      SLACK_URL_SECRET: ${{ secrets.SLACK_URL_SECRET }}
+      SLACK_CHANNEL: backend-performance-status 
+
+    steps:
+    - name: GET request to genie private page
+      env:
+        GENIE_DATA_ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET: ${{ secrets.GENIE_DATA_ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET }}
+        MAX_WAIT_TIME_IN_SECONDS: 300
+        URL: "https://genie-private.cbioportal.org/api/mutated-genes/fetch"
+        OK_RESPONSE_CODE: 200
+      # GET request to URL with a MAX_WAIT_TIME_IN_SECONDS second limit
+      #   if curl fails, automatically exit with curl's non-zero exit code
+      #   else if we did not get a OK_RESPONSE_CODE exit with a non-zero exit code
+      #   else we are OK!
+      run: |
+        curl --max-time $MAX_WAIT_TIME_IN_SECONDS -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" -X POST -H "Authorization:Bearer $GENIE_DATA_ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET" "$URL" -H "accept:application/json" -H "Content-Type:application/json" -d "{\"studyIds\":[\"genie_private\"]}" > curl.out
+        RESPONSE_CODE=`cat curl.out`
+        if [ "$RESPONSE_CODE" != "$OK_RESPONSE_CODE" ]; then
